Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “It Should be closed!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara C
Reviews.Content: I have never in my life seen a "Resort " like this. Everything that is offered is not available at this motel. No Ice machine, no phone in the room which smells of mildew in the middle of the Ghetto, town of Isabel. I felt unsafe and spent the majority of my time awake, because I was afraid to sleep. My mother & I stayed 1 night too long and left with no refund for the rest of the nights reserved. Please refer to the other reviews before you book. Do not waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY ON THIS DISGUSTING PLACE!!!”
Reviews.Author: brocktonkim
Reviews.Content: This resort is the most disgusting place i have ever been too! Ihave to agree with all the other comments,it was like we walked into the twilight zone. There was one other villa occupied when i was there,completely deserted. The pools are gross,no restaurant,snack bar or bar. There were no umbrellas at the pool,chaise lounge cusions are moldy,rusty doors and locks,nasty mattresses,no cable on the ancient tv. There was no hot water and the beach does not look like anything on line. You have to push back a huge rusty gate,manuever down a small cliff to get to the trash strewn beach.Once there it is almost impossible to swim. The water is extremely rough with 15 foot waves and a rip-tide. Stray dogs ran all around the resort and no one cleaned up after them. My kids have flea bites all over their legs,the room was loaded with fleas. There is no internet or cell phone service because the resort is blocked by a "mountain". The landscaping has been left to die. This place should be shut down!!!!!!!! I stayed 3 days then checked out and went to San Juan area,so much better. The only nice thing i can say is that the girl at the reception desk was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very unfair reviews”
Reviews.Author: rafell
Reviews.Content: Its not a Hilton or a gran melia but for the money you pay this hotel is an excellent place to unwind for a few days.rooms are small but they were clean people were extremely helpful and friendly the closer beach(2min walk) at villa pesquera its a stunning pond where the surf breaks before reaching the shore perfect for kids and local cuisine is sold at different kioskos.Playa Jobos 10min on car,its a beautiful beach perfect for veteran and beginners surfers walmart and all kinds of fast foods are within driving distances its got two very nice pools and a not so great but cheap restaurant .for the money youre paying i will surely return next year my only complain was the tv it was small and the few channels you could get were inaudible but we had a superb time!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Most disgusting place we've ever stayed.”
Reviews.Author: franmom
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay while we waited for a late night flight out of Aquadilla. There were 8 of us. We wanted just a place to stay so we could hang out and get showers. We were told we had to get two rooms at over $120 a piece because we had to wear arm bands to "have access." It was like a twilight zone experience. We were told we had to wait for our rooms to be ready....not sure why as there was NO ONE THERE. Literally, no one was at this hotel. The first pool we saw was a yellow milky color. There was no one at the restuaraunt, the second "new pool" was not better than the first. I just have to agree with everything negative said below. The rooms are disgusting, nothing worked, it was just truly, truly unbelievable. It we had paid $20 per night, I would have understood, but over $100 a night was highway robbery. We all agreed 100%....most disgusting placed we've ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Jobos Beach-Notorious for Drownings”
Reviews.Author: Ltv2988
Reviews.Content: I did not stay at this hotel but did go to Jobos Beach, the famous surfing beach. This beach has the most drownings of any beach in PR. It is apparently best for experienced surfers . There is a riptide and whirlpool on the right side of the beach which extends broadly off the rock formation from which the surfing waves come. If caught in it, at waist level only, you will be taken to the tip of the rocks into the crashing waves approx. 200 feet from shore. There is no indication of any dangerous condition from the shore. It appears quiet and shallow--a potentially great place to snorkel if you didn't know better. STAY AWAY. The locals know it is notorious for drowning Americans.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: willyib
Reviews.Content: I thought I walked into a movie scene where everyone on Earth had disappeared! The pool was not clean, milky colored water. Everything looked as though it had been abandoned some time ago. NO open bar or restaurant. NO ONE except the girl at check in was there. Although there were at least 30 -40 rooms there, none were ready and we had to wait. When we got our key and went up, the door lock was coming off the door. Sat on the edge of the bed and it flipped up in the air! Lamps were falling apart. They hadn't paid their DISH bill because there were no channels. The door to the balcony did not close properly. The grounds have not seen a rake in a long time. We have traveled Puerto Rico many times and this was by far one of the saddest properties we had seen. The girl said it was "off season" and there was literally NO ONE there. My wife refused to stay, she was afraid and crying. WE dropped the key back off at the desk and left for the Nearest Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place, near beautiful sandy beach!!!”
Reviews.Author: IvetteBayamon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the villas in this hotel last weekend october 29 to the 30th. It was a very nice and quiet place. Very close to the surfing competitions. Friendly staff, always helpful, very clean rooms. I enjoyed every minute of my stay at this hotel. The food was great I have no complaints. the beach near is beautiful and lots of places near by to visit. If you are looking to have a nice relax stay I reccomend this hotel. Will definite visit it again on christmas vacation!!!

Reviews.Title: “I cant believe they are open for business! Its that bad...”
Reviews.Author: fabjet1
Reviews.Content: This motel named resort was on the list of the accomodations from the PR Tourist company, during the RIP CURL WORD SURFING TOUR going from Oct 30 to Nov 10. It is a SHAME they recomended this motel it really gives a bad name to PR, and here is why: * Check in they insist on you wearing this stupid paper wrist band * the place looked as a gost town, only a couple of cars in the prkg lot, i guess the word has gone out, not to us unfortunately.. * 1960 style, we booked a studio for 135$, and when we walked in the smell of mildew was overwhelming! would have give asthma to the kids. * got moved to one of their hotel rooms, smell was better but very old deco, shower in plastic, cracked everywhere and repaired with glue, white used old towels that looked grey. * A/C in wall was blowing directly in your face when you were in bed, had to move the bed. * they refused to refund the difference between the studio originally booked at 135$ and the rate of the smaller rooms at 113$. Old, dirty, awfull smell, the tourist board and health department shout SHUT THEM DOWN! We run away from that place at 9am the next morning....

Reviews.Title: “Hotel or Bad Motel???”
Reviews.Author: Vert_PR
Reviews.Content: The room was full of dust, windows were dirty, the bathroom curtains were too short and water get on all the bathroom floor. This is the first and last time I stay on the crappy "hotel" and I'll make sure non of my friends make the same mistake I did.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: aygarcia
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be shut down and given an overall fix-up !! I don't understand how they advertise themselves ! Rooms are filthy, smell bad, rooms infested with insects (even on and in the mattresses and pillows, no security on the doors, no communication (telephone or celphones), furniture in general are old, beds and mattresses are un-sleepable, and in general, just plain old terrible. I will never stay there again and definitely won't recommend to anyone. It was a really bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster Paradise”
Reviews.Author: JaviTCO
Reviews.Content: No water the first night, no hot water at all, ice maker machine damage, aparently years ago, snack machine with out of date, sept 09 to be exactly, it was raining and room began to came water by the entrance and balcony, a lot of peaple arguing with front desk, three channel tv, only one with perfect signal, the restaurant was empty so i can not qualify the food, but if empty I can imagine why. All around completely neglected. I just ask to from desk why, and she told me, that a change in administration make a lot of changes, a sorrow for this once upon a time paradise. Some local agency need to make action, this condition is not aceptable, thats simple. Forget about internet or remote controls.

Reviews.Title: “The name of the hotel should be Costa Dorada Beach Last Resort hotel”
Reviews.Author: keeptraveling01
Reviews.Content: I was booked in this hotel through my company. Checking in, the lobby had no a/c and I was bitten 8 times while checking in. By colleague got bug bites in his room. There is no cell phone service beyond the hotel lobby. The phones in the room didn't work. The internet didn't work in the rooms and the TV didn't work. No communication to the outside world. The only working phone at the hotel was the phone at the receptionist desk. The rooms are at least a 5 minute walk to the working phone. The rooms are disqusting. My bathtub had rust/stains, not sure what, covering the bottom of the tub. One towel literally had holes as big as a fist with yellow stains and the other towel had what appeared to be black mold on the corners on the towel. The bathroom counter still had gunk leftover from a previous guest and all the mirrors had finger and handprints on them. The walls in the room had holes in them. I never had hot water during my stay. My co-worker had standing water up to his ankles while taking a shower. This took 2/3 days to fix. Put your luggage on top of furniture, when I got up to use the bathroom in the middle of the night, a long centipide/worm type animal was crawling across the floor. This was the first but not last. The kitchenette should be condemned. The applicances, dishes, counter, etc were filthy! When I was moved to another room, the back door next to my bed didn't lock and the receptionist didn't think it was a big deal and it could wait til morning. She stated she didn't want to disturb the manager. As a single traveling person, this is the wrong answer. The window glass slates didn't shut either. No landscaping appeared to have occurred in years. There isn't much cleaning that gets done in the rooms either. The bottom sheet of my bed was torn and the top sheet had stains. There was no customer service to speak of. I could go on but I think you get the picture of how truly horrible this hotel is. Do not stay here if you can avoid it!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of potention, short on delivery.”
Reviews.Author: slafrance3
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Costa Dorada on a family vacation to Puerto Rico. I was underwhelmed at the drive to get to the "resort". You have to go through the town of Isabela, which is a slum at best with tiny one way streets that constantly make you think you are going to crash into something. For the resort itself, we got there at "low season". The place was deserted. At the "villas" that we were "upgraded" to, there were 4 other cars out of 72 possible units, and noone was in the main hotel. The place looked like a ghost town. We were struck by what my wife and I thought was a tremendous amount of potential with the place. 2 private pools, poolside restaurant, right on the beach, coconut trees covered the property. The staff at the place was very nice and courteous. However, the room we were in was horrid. The beds were old and worn out and hurt my back. The place had a funny smell and was infested with gnats. Lastly, they made us were these stupid paper armbands for 2 days that would cost us $25.00 apiece if we lost! When I asked what they were for, they told us it was for pool use. Forgive me for being blunt, but your staff can't track 4 families of guests using the pool? This place would take some work to earn the title of resort. For the money I paid, I was expecting alot more.

Reviews.Title: “Awful reservation experience -- okay place to stay for short time”
Reviews.Author: PallidinMinnesota
Reviews.Content: We had been referred to Costa Dorado by the Parador Hau de Mar because Hau de Mar had screwed up our reservations there. Costa Dorado stated that they had "a view of the beach from every room." Yes, we found, but only if you lean way over the balcony and stretch to see it off in the distance. We were told ". . . Yes, we have immediate access to the beach," only to find that one must first find out how to get through the one and only GATE to then CROSS a highway to get to the beach, which is really NOT good for walking due to high waves. We must say, however, the Dorado had two wonderful swimming pools for our 30 minutes of vigorous lap swimming AND for children! The room we found to be clean, albeit in the Howard Johnson style of the 1960s, but, while told they were "sold out," we could not see enough cars but for perhaps 10 rooms -- and so deadly quiet -- where were all these ghost guests! We left after ONE night vs. our two night reservation, but the hotel staff REFUSED to refund our second night room charge -- we can not recommend them to anyone and will ourselves NEVER stay at the Dorado again!

Reviews.Title: “Biggest dissapointment ever, should not be considered a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: misionterra
Reviews.Content: I can't even believe the name says Resort. First of all, they had lost my reservation. Second, the room was dirty and had candy wraps under the beds. Third, cockroach problems. Fourth, rooms smell horrible. Fifth, only 5 tv channels available. My wife and I only stayed for an hour and left. Horrible. I'm from Puerto Rico and would never ever recomend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Are people being paid to write bad reviews??”
Reviews.Author: cfaulkner1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Costa Dorada June of 2009. I head read reviews and was a bit worried about what I had gotten myself into. Turns out I had nothing to worry about. The room was clean, if not a bit musty smelling (which was quickly fixed by opening our patio doors.) There was a small fridge, ancient looking coffee pot (you do have to buy the coffee from a vending machine) and iron. The room is great sized. The wardrobe in it is very nice and roomy. The entire wall of doors/windows was fantastic (which had a regular sliding glass door lock and the metal pin that slides through both doors that is very typical of a sliding glass door lock.) Toilet worked fine. Lots of towels. Clean sheets. Zero cockroaches or other bugs were seen in our room. No mold, either. Maybe we were just lucky? The pool was clean, except right after a massive storm. Then there were bugs in the pool. Go figure. It's true that there are turtles being kept in something that looks like a fenced off fire pit. It's pretty filthy and there are a lot of turtles in there. I felt bad for them. No, the fountain didn't work, but I didn't see any exposed electrical wires anywhere. There is no highway you have to cross to get to the beach. Where do people get this? Or that there's traffic on it?? There's a road that is barely more than a bike path, which is blocked off to vehicles, that separates Costa Dorado's property from the beach. If you go down to the beach from Costa Dorada's back gate, you have to do a bit of careful manuvering down the sand/rocks to get to the rocky beach. Or you can walk 3 minutes to the left and walk directly onto the gorgeous, beautiful beach (where it is completely rock free. I have pictures to attest to this.) I did like that there was a shower type thing (like they have when you leave most beaches) when you first walk back onto the property so you can spray off the sand from the beach. The only time I was afraid was when I was swinging on the hammock, reading, and a giant coconut dropped from the tree the hammock was tied to. This prompted me to go back in my room and read. Otherwise, you're not supposed to be on the grass. We never ate there so we can't attest to the food quality. There is, however, a restaurant right down the street that has amazing coconut flan. The pool supposedly closes at some hour every night, but both nights I was there I was in the pool until 2 AM. No one said a word to us. The game room wasn't open the first night, but it was the second night. And other reviewers are correct in saying the resort isn't close to any of the "main attractions." It makes it quiet with mostly secluded beaches! We were glad to be so far away from everything else! The hotel staff were by no means rude. They helped us when we asked, but left us alone otherwise. We were given neon colored bracelets to wear (like you get at a club) but as soon as I saw that some of the Puerto Rican guests weren't wearing theirs, I took mine off. I had it on for less than 6 hours. No one said anything to me and I left and came back to the hotel at least 3 times a day. There are no real parking spots to the hotel, so you sort of make them up as you go ad hope everyone else follows suit. The parking lot does flood when it rains. Oh, they do charge $3 a day for maid service. Really, I have no complains with this "resort." Would I call it a resort? No. A decent hotel on a crime ridden island? Yes. It's on a beach and tropical. That's the feel I had from the hotel. Would I stay there again? Only if it wasn't so expensive. And be warned: I have AT&T and could not get a signal at the hotel or within about 10 minutes of it!

Reviews.Title: “high expectations from the photo's, huge shock in real life!”
Reviews.Author: telltails1
Reviews.Content: I should have read the reviews! This place is an absolute dump. We were the only guests in this ghost hotel. The toilet was broken, so we asked to change rooms. The front office staff was not very helpful and seemed bothered by our complaint about the broken toilet. We got given this piece of paper with house rules...and a band around our wrist to show that we were guests??? There wasn't anybody else they could have mistaken us for. The pool was dirty, the room was worn out. We bumped into the chef, who looked to scruffy for words, wearing dirty clothes. Needless to say we ate out. The pictures on this website promised the world but delivered a dump. In my books this is false advertising!!!!! They should be sued.

Reviews.Title: “The Resort From Hell!”
Reviews.Author: TerriblyDisappointed
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the resort for a wedding that took place there in August 2008, the room was disgusting and the pool was absolutely filthy just like their bathrooms. I couldn't believe the conditions, it was so run down. How dare they call this place a resort! It was more like The Resort from HELL! I would NOT recommend this dump they call a resort at all! In fact they should have paid me for staying there!

Reviews.Title: “Dump of a motel”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_flyer4
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel we have ever been to. We checked in for an hour and left. The rooms were dirty with roaches and dead bugs. The bathrooms had mold and broken shower. The landscaping was unkept with electrical wires left exposed, a danger for children. It was definately not worth the price. It is nowhere near a beach resort as they call themselves. We went to Villa Montana in Isabela which was very clean and family friendly with beautiful views of the island, that was a beach resort. We also recommend Rincon Beach resort.

Reviews.Title: “Pit of Desertion”
Reviews.Author: SraRose
Reviews.Content: Stay far away from this deserted dump. Roaches as big as my thumb (except for the baby roaches running around inside the unplugged refrigerator). The balcony glass window as broken. The balcony door locked with a hole drilled in the wall and a pin made from a stick. The chair had three legs. The whole place smelled of mold. The carpet was filthy. Views of drug deals on the street corner. They are holding wild turtles captive in a pen the size of a laundry basket with stagnant water and no food. Absolutely unbelieveable. I am so disgusted and overwhelmed!

Reviews.Title: “My experience at the Costa Dorada Beach Resort”
Reviews.Author: boricua27
Reviews.Content: I just arrived from my trip there and the hotel is not that bad , at check in ,I was attended by a young lady with the playboy bunny earrings, that was weird. They need more staff to clean facilities and the pool and to provide efficiency in the restaurant . Staff were friendly but sometimes tired and overwhelmed ( It's not easy for 1 or 2 waitress take orders of more than 6 tables when the average is about 25 or more persons). Food order was delayed and tuesday breakfast was poor, and there was no orange juice, regular sugar or napkins available. Buffet dinner was really good but the dinner didn't include BEVERAGE we had to pay 1.50 for every soft drink and we had the inclusive offer, just because the soft drink machine did not work and the hotel administation did not have the kindness to include the beverage????? The center pieces of the restaurant had spider web in all of them, the pool wasn"t that clean ,the bathroom outside weren"t clean and didn'T have paper or soap. The gameroom was closed almost all the time and there was no security around. It's OKAY to go and it would be better if hotel administration consider my suggestions to improve it"s service.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon from Hell”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our stay at Costa Dorada Beach Resort, which is by far the worst resort in Puerto Rico. It definitely does not live up to its name. I live in the Northern area in Puerto Rico and love doing tourism within the Island. I've been to many Paradors, Hotels and Resorts in Puerto Rico so I have a strong basis for comparison. My husband and I planned a short honeymoon vacation and made a reservation for 3 nights/4 days. However, we only stayed 2 nights because of our terrible experience at the resort. The rooms were very unattended; we had ants all over the bathroom; the air conditioning was either too cold or too hot and we could not control the temperature (if we wanted to change the temperature we had to call the front desk so they could send someone with a master control to change it); we found pubic hairs in the bed; the balcony view was a decorative fountain with green water; the "restaurant" does not have air conditioner so there were flyes all over the food being served; the beach is too dangerous to go in the water and there's absolutely nothing to do but go to the pool so you'll be very bored. The personnel strives to give good service and treat customers the best they can. However, this does not helps at all because the facilities are extremely deteriorated. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY! RincÃ³n Beach Resort and RincÃ³n of the Seas are excellent alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed. Go to another place.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Didn't expect what I found in Costa Dorada Beach Resort. I live in PR and this is the worst hotel to stay. The room service is poor they didn't put toilet paper and they changed from high to low the air conditioner. The maintenance of the hotel is the worst. Now I can see why I didnâ€™t find any pictures of the rooms and surrounding areas. I reserved for 4 days and 3 nights and I only stayed for 3 days. In 2005 I stayed in Rincon Beach Resort (in Rincon) and I give a 5 out of 5. All the opposite from Costa Dorada Beach Resort. I also heard that Villa MontaÃ±a (in Isabela) is also a good hotel. Donâ€™t stay if you want to save money. Rincon of the Seas and Rincon Beach Resort are better. Also there are many guesthouses in Rincon with excellent service. Iâ€™m a surfer who lives in Ponce, PR and believe me Costa Dorada is the worst. Things that I enjoyed: Isabela, waves, and Happy Bellyâ€™s restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Worst of All”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The picture looked good so I reserved for 3 nights.Well first they put paper wristbands on us to wear while there,then it turns out you have to cross a public road to get over to the beach.That's not too bad but there was a gate that's kept locked to get to the beach and no one knew where the key was !The grounds are filled with nice palm trees that are filled with coconuts that drop.A helmet would be nice.In the room the flapper lock on door was hanging by 1 screw,the phone didn't work,the clock did't work ,to lock the sliding patio door they had drilled a hole at the top of it and slid a nail in to lock it.It goes on &on.After one sleepless night we checked out.

Reviews.Title: “I'd rather stay in a motel 6!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This past weekend was the worst in history, my husband and I have not seen such a dirty so called "Resort". This is the first thing that comes to my mind, a resort?? Who named this place a resort? Areas are dirty, all the rails by the stairs are so full of rust that I'm surprised they have not falled off. In the bar by the pool the very rude waitress charged my husband who is american $4 for a small perrier water. When he told me (I'm puertorican) I went back and she got very nervous so gave me $1 back, charging him more because she thought he was a gringo tourist. My husband only stayed 10 minutes inside the pool because it was so filthy you could not even see the bottom, an old and rusty jacuzzi by the pool full of bugs, the kids pool dirty and full of bugs also. Now if you're shocked wait until you hear this! The rooms are nothing like they have in their advertisement. An old, cheap and dirty mattress that would not stay in place, sheets had old stains God knows from what, a/c was blowing in my face but that's how the room is arranged. Coffemaker yes with 2 cups and one of them very dirty yeak! oh but no coffee....yes you have to buy the coffee in a vending machine for the price of $2.....the shower made me gag because it was so dirty and ants all over the walls, curly black hair by the toilet!! we both have ash blonde hair. No guides in the room to where was the restaurant located, if they had room service, ammenities located or nothing. My husband and I had to look for everything by ourselves and then they have so many rules like no food or drinks in the rooms, no visitors, etc...When they told us that in the reception we felt we were going into a prison. All this for the price of $169.00 dollars per night. With this kind of money we could have stayed at a 5 star hotel. We will never stay there again and I am going to make sure these people get visited by the Health department. My husband says any motel would have been better. Don't fall for the pictures they have in their web site, that's the mistake I made.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was the perfect quiet retreat for my family of five. We always travel with my children and my mother so the villa worked out well. Everyone had there own space. Since it was still the off season it was relatively quiet. The down side of this is that not all of the amenities were available during our entire stay. (The villa cabana was closed during the week as was the gift shop). We deemed this a small price to pay for the home style comfort and convenience we did have. We will definately be going back. Oh and just a side note they will be opening a small casino within the next few months on the property.

Reviews.Title: “poor excuse for a resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and our 16 month old daughter spent one night at this poor excuse for a resort. We paid $130 for a room that looked like a cheap hotel room (a la Motel 6). There was no remote for the TV, the blankets and pillows had black hairs on them and the AC blasted the person sleeping on the bed next to it- with no way to turn the vents. Most of the staff were rude to us, because we were Americans. Although the grounds were beautiful, the restaurant was totally over-priced for mediocre food. We were forced to pay $9 for a breakfast buffet and were not given directions about food tickets or bracelets to wear at the resort pool. we felt we were treated badly because we were Americans and will never stay at this so called "resort" again. There were many Puerto Ricans spending their holiday weekend at the Resort the same night we were, and they were given instant attention and extra care. We were not even given a high chair for our daughter after making a request. When 2 other Puerto Rican couples came to dinner with small children...they were brought high chairs immediately. This place was dirty and totally over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to Costa Dorado about 2yrs ago with my family the six of us stood ina room that sleeps six the beds in our room were comfortable but the room with the full bed felt like a concrete bed but thats the only bad thing i have to say about the place we went to the local supermarket and bought some food for the weekend since its like an apartment so u can cook ur own food, so i never tried the food in the restaurant but i passed it and it looks real nice the pool is clean the basketball court is by the beach i stood in villa across from the court the place is gorgeous the beach is so beautiful and when the sun rises u can climb up this coral kind of little mountain and the view is spectacular and if u dare to go to the other side of the reef theres a little cave u can explore that was to us a nice private jacuzzi when the ocean fills it they even have a mini beach where u can put ur kids there and wont have to worry about them drowning if u go ull see what i mean the water is crystal clear beautiful i mean its like being in paradise the people are so nice. the day we left i felt so bad i swore that when i got older when i returned to puerto rico id spend my whole vacation there. they even have a trail hike through the mountain and a horse coral if thats ur kind of thing. the place is like i said before paradise.

HotelInfo.Name: Costa Dorada Beach Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 900 Calle Emilio Gonzalez, Isabela 00662, Puerto Rico
